IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: EQUIPS YOUTH WITH SKILLS FOR ACADEMIC SUCCESS, LIFE MANAGEMENT, SPIRITUAL GROWTH AND CHRISTIAN LEADERSHIP.
IRS990.MissionDesc: URBAN PROMISE MINISTRIES SEEKS TO EQUIP THE CHILDREN AND TEENS OF CAMDEN, NJ WITH SKILLS NECESSARY FOR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, LIFE MANAGEMENT, SPIRITUAL GROWTH, AND CHRISTIAN LEADERSHIP.
IRS990.Desc: CAMDENFORWARD SCHOOL (K-8) AND URBANPROMISE ACADEMY (9-12): PRIVATE SCHOOLS THAT PROVIDE 150+ STUDENTS WITH QUALITY EDUCATION AND UNIQUE EXTRACURRICULAR OPPORTUNITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS & SUMMER CAMPS: EXTENDED LEARNING AND RECREATIONAL CAMPS THAT PROVIDE SAFE, FUN, AND POSITIVE SPACES FOR 300+ CHILDREN AGES 5 -14.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: YOUTH EMPLOYMENT PROGRAMS: TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT FOR UP TO 100 TEENS AND YOUNG ADULTS INCLUDING ACADEMIC ENRICHMENT AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT. YOUTH GAIN EXPERIENCE IN THE FIELDS OF EDUCATION, COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, AND ENVIRONMENTAL ADVOCACY.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING: HANDS-ON AND JOURNEY-BASED ACTIVITIES FOR 250+ YOUTH AND LOCAL RESIDENTS INCLUDING ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, REAL-WORLD APPLICATIONS OF CLASSROOM LEARNING (E.G. BOAT BUILDING), AND ON-THE-WATER PADDLING EXPERIENCES. WELLNESS INITIATIVES: ENGAGE ALL STUDENTS AND YOUTH PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS IN A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE OVERALL WELL-BEING. IN ADDITION, URBANPROMISE WORKS WITH FAMILIES TO ADDRESS EMERGENCY NEEDS THROUGH OUR EMERGENCY FAMILY FUND AND BY WORKING CLOSELY WITH URBANPROMISE MINISTRIES COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ON REFERRING FAMILIES TO THE COMMUNITY FOOD CO-OP. FAMILIES ARE ALSO CONNECTED WITH ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY RESOURCES ON AN AS-NEEDED BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: URBANPROMISE IS A NONPROFIT CORPORATION THAT IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN MADE IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN DETERMINED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE NOT TO BE A "PRIVATE FOUNDATION" WITHIN THE MEANING OF SECTION 509(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE ORGANIZATION ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAXES IN ACCORDANCE WITH AUTHORITATIVE GUIDANCE, WHICH PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE APPROPRIATE TAXING AUTHORITY. MEASUREMENT OF THE TAX UNCERTAINTY OCCURS IF THE RECOGNITION THRESHOLD HAS BEEN MET. MANAGEMENT DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO TAX UNCERTAINTIES THAT MET THE THRESHOLD FOR YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022. CURRENTLY, THE 2020, 2021, AND 2022 TAX YEARS ARE OPEN AND SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AND THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. HOWEVER, THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT CURRENTLY UNDER AUDIT NOR HAS THE ORGANIZATION BE CONTACTED BY THESE JURISDICTIONS. THERE WERE NO INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAXES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D

THE CAMDEN FORWARD SCHOOL OF URBAN PROMISE MINISTRIES HAS A NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY THAT CAN BE FOUND IN THE ADMISSION PROCEDURES DOCUMENT AS WELL AS PROMINENT POSTING ON ITS WEBSITE. 99% OF URBAN PROMISE STUDENTS ARE MINORITY STUDENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: STAFF IDENTIFY NEEDS OF YOUTH AROUND EMERGENCY ISSUES. AN EMERGENCY COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF ADVISORY BOARD MEMBERS, STAFF, AND VOLUNTEERS REVIEW THE NEEDS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS AGAINST A SET OF CRITERIA. AWARDS ARE MADE BASED ON MEETING CRITERIA AND ON AVAILABLE FUNDS.

URBANPROMISE HAS A COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM CALLED AMBASSADORS OF HOPE (AOH). SIO WEDDERBURN WAS A KEY EMPLOYEE AT URBANPROMISE (ONE OF 4 VP'S) AND HER SON ATTENDS A UNIVERSITY. HER SON MET ALL THE CRITERIA OF THE AMBASSADORS OF HOPE GUIDELINES, INCLUDING (A)URBANPROMISE INVOLVEMENT; (B) APPLICATION PROCESS; AND (C) FINANCIAL AID AND COLLEGE APPLICATION REVIEW. THE AOH COMMITTEE APPROVED THE SCHOLARSHIP IN THE FALL OF 2022 WITH SIO RECUSING HERSELF FROM INVOLVEMENT IN THE DECISIONS RELATED TO THE SCHOLARSHIP.

EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING: HANDS-ON AND JOURNEY-BASED ACTIVITIES FOR 250+ YOUTH AND LOCAL RESIDENTS INCLUDING ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT, REAL-WORLD APPLICATIONS OF CLASSROOM LEARNING (E.G. BOAT BUILDING), AND ON-THE-WATER PADDLING EXPERIENCES. WELLNESS INITIATIVES: ENGAGE ALL STUDENTS AND YOUTH PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS IN A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE OVERALL WELL-BEING. IN ADDITION, URBANPROMISE WORKS WITH FAMILIES TO ADDRESS EMERGENCY NEEDS THROUGH OUR EMERGENCY FAMILY FUND AND BY WORKING CLOSELY WITH URBANPROMISE MINISTRIES COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ON REFERRING FAMILIES TO THE COMMUNITY FOOD CO-OP. FAMILIES ARE ALSO CONNECTED WITH ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY RESOURCES ON AN AS-NEEDED BASIS.
MADE AVAILABLE TO THE BOARD TO REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.
MONITORED BY THE BOARD AT MONTHLY MEETINGS.
